string-array.name: info_item_children
string-array.item:
Ammonia sources can be chemical (i.e. household cleaning Ammonia) or organic (i.e. ammonia naturally produced by decaying shrimp, or as a waste product). 

Chemical ammonia is recommended as it provides greater control over dosage levels. It is also less likely to encourage "bacterial blooms" during the cycle. 

If using store-bought ammonia, check to make sure it does not contain any surfactants or fragrances. Check the ingredients label if unsure. The ammonia should not form bubbles or foam when shaken.
Water Testing Kits often come as either packs of paper strips or as liquid test kits. \n\nLiquid tests kits are recommended as they are more accurate than paper strips.
In addition to cleaning substrate, water siphons make water changes substantially simpler.

A simple bucket is very useful for conducting water changes. It is also a helpful place to store items related to the aquarium.\n\nThis bucket should not used for other tasks (i.e. cleaning) because of the risk of contaminating the aquarium.
Water Conditioner removes chlorine and chloramines from tap water.\n\nBoth these chemicals are toxic to fish and cycling bacteria.

Substrate is the stuff that lines the aquarium floor; examples include gravel, sand or soil.

To clean substrate, place it inside a bucket and fill the bucket with water. Once the substrate has settled to the bottom, tip out the water.

Repeat the process until the water runs clear.

string-array.name: info_item_child_optional
string-array.item: In addition to their aesthetic effects, plants can help speed up or even replace a fishless cycle. Plants use ammonia, nitrite and nitrate as a food source, which reduces the load on the bacteria in the aquarium.\n\nIf present in a high enough concentration, a \"silent cycle\" may take place. This is where the ammonia produced by the tank\'s wildlife is low enough that it can be absorbed completely by the plants.
Bacteria grow on aquarium surfaces. This mostly takes place inside the filter, but decorations will also host some bacteria.

Seed material can drastically reduce the time it takes to cycle a new tank.

Seed material consists of taking an item from an established, cycled tank (i.e. a piece of filter media) and introducing it to the new tank. The bacteria present will begin to multiply immediately under the right conditions.

Keep in mind that it is also possible to transmit pathogens in this way, so ensure the seeding tank is healthy.
